summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 between FBI and OIG personnel discussing scheduling coordination for interviews related to the Epstein case. The emails mention a grand jury date, a high-profile homicide interview, and resource constraints due to summer leave.

persons.name: Darrius Dupree
persons.context: Named as the subject of a scheduled interview that the email chain is attempting to coordinate.

events.title: Grand jury date for MCC callers
events.description: Individuals calling from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) have a grand jury date scheduled.

events.title: High-profile homicide interview
events.description: The FBI squad has a scheduled interview related to a high-profile homicide case.

keyFacts: The email chain shows inter-agency coordination (FBI, OIG, USAO) for scheduling interviews in the Epstein investigation.
A grand jury date for individuals held at the MCC was imminent (the next day, August 21, 2019).
The FBI squad mentions being reactive and having resource constraints due to summer annual leave.
An interview with an individual named Darrius Dupree was being scheduled.
The emails reference the 'Adams part of the case,' indicating a specific aspect or individual within the broader Epstein investigation.
